data.title: love this place
data.text:
I'm glad to see more and more of them around.  I can't tell you I've actually had a meal there other then apps and those stupidly addictive truffle fries.  must have.

the beers are great and so far, all the locations have a great staff.

defintely worth a stop if you can't decide what to do.

data.title: Always closed to locals on Game Day
data.text: I am no longer going to eat or drink at this restaurant.  Second game day I try to go eat and drink prior to the ASU game and they are closed for a visiting team.   I used to frequent here on other occasions, but no more.

data.title: Late lunch great service
data.text: We were hot and hungry just off the plane from Boston. Looking for fast and good with good libations. Found it all. Downtown Tempe has so many restaurants to choose from definitely put this on your list.

data.title: Try the garlic patato fries
data.text: The location of the restaurant is great. You can view the town if you take a seat in the balkony. There are also vegan options and it is not an expensive restaurant although the architecture and the location is so good. The staff is friendly and will help you anytime you need help.

data.title: ASU Parents weekend 2016
data.text: Late dinner around 8:30 on Friday night. Service poor food good. Waiter never checked on us, he was too busy. Management issues.  Great location. Should have been better.  We will try again.

data.title: Classy but not pretentious
data.text: The food was very good as well as the drinks.Wait staff was the best I've seen in a while. They have some special fries there that are out of this world. Can't remember the name, but they are on the menu. They have herbs on them and maybe some parmesan cheese, Num!!!

data.title: You know what you will get
data.text: Solid food, beer, and service.  I was at a conference and everyone seemed to flow to this location at the end of the evening.  Good beer and solid service.  I also had dinner there the first night.  Solid  beer bread soup.  Everyone else also liked their meals!

data.title: S 'ok
data.text: Sports bar ambiance, sports bar menu, sports bar staffing,       no suprises here.   Good wings   Cold beer          Ample FREE PARKING   .Multiple locations .   S'ok

data.title: Great brew & service but not the snapper
data.text: I would definitely return and look forward to sharing the experience with a friend. Beer is great and the staff is very helpful and engaging.  Fun setting ! Great neighborhood.  As a New Englander I should have known to stay away from the fish and sure enough the Red Snapper was rubber and fishy to the taste. When will I learn the desert is too far from the sea!  The sweet potato fries are real good and did I mention some excellent brews - personally I enjoyed the Czech Pilsner and the Mills Mission IPA. I shall return hut I'll skip the fish.

data.title: Good food!
data.text:
We arrived at our hotel, and was starving! The front desk clerk at our hotel said this is a good spot. Just a short walk from our hotel. Mill Ave. Is very busy, so parking could be tough. 

I had a kobe cheeseburger and added bacon, it came with garlic fries. The fries were very good, never had garlic fries, but will expect them to be as tasty as these were.

My lady had the mushroom chicken pasta with a cream sauce. It was tasty, pretty light for a pasta.

I wouldn't have a problem eating here again. I

data.title: Good beer, good food
data.text:
I always enjoy my eating experience at GB and highly recommend the Cajun Pasta.

The IPA selections and appetizers for our party of 7 were tasty.

I look forward to dining at GB whenever possible.

data.title: Great service, delicious food, and an excellent view.
data.text: The food is excellent. Their garlic fries are delicious and I definitely recommend that you try their beer infused mussels. It is a unique taste that I hadn't tried before even though my boyfriend and I are both huge fans of mussels and have tried many different ones. The service provided was excellent and our waitress was attentive and friendly even though there was a crowd. The view we had by the window was so nice because you can see Mill Ave coming alive on the weekend and watch the sunset. The moscato was delicious and the margarita was even better. My boyfriend knows his alcohol and he said they had top notch alcohol which is what made the margarita delicious. It is a bit pricey to eat here especially if you are doing cocktails. Their happy hour, although they don't have one on Friday or Saturday, can be well worthwhile. I would definitely return here. Highly recommend it.

data.title: Good place for dinner with friends in downtown Tempe
data.text: Came here twice in one week with friends. The first night (Sunday) was not very busy so the service was better, but both times we were pleased with the service, the food and the ambience. They gave us a discount card after our first visit which saved us a nice amount on our bill.

data.title: Stopped in for drinks
data.text: Stopped in for drinks one afternoon. Drinks were good a little better than average. Appetizer was very good. Service from the kitchen was a little slow though. Our server was attentive and friendly.

data.title: Boggy meal
data.text:
Very average,  to poor.  Food didn't impress,  server thought he was Mr GQ.
Even my cocktail was a short pour.

data.title: Nice dinner out!
data.text: We had a nice dinner here it was fairly quiet for a Sunday night.  We were able to talk & watch hikers going up A mountain.  We had a delicious Champagne Mojito, good Lobster & Shrimp Tacos, & a Gastro Pub Burger that was quite tasty with a bacon jam (would've loved even more), carmelized onions, gargonzola, greens, & a blue cheese sauce on almost a prezel roll.  Their sides of garlic fries and sauerkraut & bacon potato croquettes were really good.  Our server was very pleasant & helpful with several questions that we had for her.

data.title: Pick your brew - then match your food to it!
data.text: Gordon Biersch is another favorite eatery of the ConsimWorld Expo gaming crowd.  VAST selection of brews from all over, great menu from light bites to LARGE meals.  Wait staff is knowledgable, attentive, and got the order for our group of 8 right 100%, to my surprise.  If you eat "light", you can save room for the creme brulee, which is outstanding!  The steak salad is lovely, but the biggest rave for our party was the sausage plate, with 3 large wursts and red cabbage.  If you like beer, and excellent food to go with it, this is the place.  They accept reservations (this was off-season, but we had 6 one night and 8 another, so we made reservations).  There is also an elevator from the ground floor...the bar and dining room are up a LOT of stairs.

data.title: Interesting menu. Tasty Food! Beer selection is disappointing
data.text: We had some won-ton nachos! Really light and crispy with a light layer of cheese and huge chunks of chicken.  So good!  We both had the chopped salad - really good - but nothing was actually "chopped!"  The beer selection was limited and disappointing for a beer place.

data.title: Very good service
data.text: We had burgers, which were very good. The IPA beer was tasty too. Service was excellent and I'd go back again and eat the same meal on my next visit

data.title: Never again.
data.text:
We asked for two margaritas with no salt. Our server forget to say "no salt" to the bartender. These mistakes happen.

When she realized and corrected the order with bartender, the bartender decided to cut corners and pour our drink into an unsalted glass, getting a huge amount of salt mixed into the margarita in the process, clearly hoping we would not notice.

Bartender did remake one drink, but was unfriendly and unsmiling and chose to play the blame game instead of admitting that he was lazy and thought he could pull one over on us. Seriously, how could we not notice that much salt in our drink?

Of my favorite food items, only one remains on the menu. It's the same price, but it's now obviously smaller portions.

We used to be faithful GB customers. We will not be going back.
